text: Suicide made things WORSE  I had a problem that was completely my fault  I was lying in bed feeling sorry for myself and I really needed someone I could talk to instead of just dumping on reddit  so I called the hotline  thinking I should try it  I didn t want them to send the police  the suicide I was contemplating wouldn t take place till tomorrow night  so I was careful not to give the operator my address  Eventually we got to talking about getting a counselor  She found so many results in my zip code that she told me she had to narrow by address  By this time  I figured I d told her enough times that I was inside my bedroom which was in a house with lots of people in it enough that it would be fine   Five minutes later  my dad knocks on my door to tell me the police are here   So now my parents are both livid at me  telling me I could have talked to one of them   could not actually have talked to them  they re an involved party and I told them this and they won t listen  and wondering why the hell I  lied to the operator and told her I was on the roof  Never once told her I was on the roof  We were to the point of discussing counselors before she got my address  My parents don t seem to realize that I was seriously going to kill myself   Not helping    year old little sister had a friend over for a sleepover  One of the cops yelled at my sister and scared her and her friend  And of course the friend called her mom and now her mom knows  They also flashed their stupid high beam lights all over the roof so now the whole neighborhood knows  I don t care  but my parents are holding it against me   The sad part  the operator really helped me and put me in a good place before the police showed
summary: Suicide made things worse for me. I called the hotline to talk to a counselor. The operator got my address before she knew I was on the roof. The police came to my house and scared my sister and her friend. They yelled at her and scared them.
cleaned: suicide thing bad call hotline talk counselor operator get address know roof police come house scare sister friend yell scare

text: Please stay strong  I am so broken inside and have been for weeks  A very important person in my life took their life  My brain hasn t been the same since   Life is hard  I know all too well  Life becomes harder for those you leave behind  I wonder how my friend could make such a selfish choice when they knew continuing on would be hard for me   My selfish wish to all who are struggling out there  Stay strong  Please  I know it s hard but if you leave  you make living harder for someone else Please stay strong
summary: A very important person in my life took their life. My brain hasn't been the same since. Life becomes harder for those you leave behind. My wish is that all who are struggling will stay strong and not make life harder for someone else.
cleaned: important person life take life brain not life hard leave wish struggle stay strong not life hard

text: I don t want to talk about itThe first thing the people from the hotline say is to talk to a professional and to talk to the people close around me like my family and friends  But I don t want to do that  I really just want to not live anymore I feel like if I talk to them about it  they would convince me not to hurt myself  But thats what I want to do  I want to stop failing my classes  I want to stop my mom from getting mad at me  I want to  stop disappointing my friends  I just want it to stop Im tired of all this self inflicted pain that Im causing my own actions  I am one lazy piece of shit  just a huge procrastinator  In the end I feel like i deserve to die  My parents make so many sacrifices for me and I dont even make it for them  Its like I dont even care  If action speaks louder than words than yeah I guess I dont care  And then I shouldnt talk about it and keep my mouth shut
summary: According to the hotline, the first thing to do is to talk to a professional and talk to the people close around you like family and friends, but she doesn't want to do that as she just wants to not live anymore. She wants to stop failing her classes and disappointing her friends.
cleaned: accord hotline thing talk professional talk people close like family friend not want want not live anymore want stop fail class disappoint friend

text: My kid is my roadblockSo  been living with clinical depression since   been through somewhere between   medications  some in combination and some not  I have been in psychiatric ward twice  Once in   closed ward for suicide attempt and once late last year  open ward  for ECT treatment Electrocshock  I m as active as I can be  on days when it feels possible  I have been through cognitive therapy  neurotherapy  exercise regiments  that I follow on days when it feels possible  I don t want to be accused by doctors that my depressions stem from lack of exercise  yo   cm   kg  and pretty much every  flavor of the month  in psychiatric treatment I will go back in for another series of ECTs as soon as my therapist gives the  go  and after that is completed  I have tried everything  Sure  new medications  but after   years of trying that  I kind of lost faith in that Sorry about the wall of text  now to the issue   My one roadblock from not slitting radial artery from wrist to elbow  is my  year old son  It s a very strong roadblock   for now  He s too young atm to understand that isolate myself in my  mancave  and my hope is to get much better by the time he  and his friends  DO understand what s happening  and why dad is being so weird  I feel like I m working towards the clock  and atm   completing  the ECT  I had   but normal is   with  refresh  every  nd month  feels like the last chance  and maintaining the roadblock   I just really needed to get this out  that you for reading if you managed through it all  and I hope you manage to create a great day for yourself
summary: My son is my roadblock to getting better from clinical depression. He's too young to understand why his dad isolates himself in his mancave. He will go back in for another series of ECTs as soon as his therapist gives the go.
cleaned: son roadblock get well clinical depression young understand dad isolate man cave series act soon therapist give
